newsitem.title: USA: PC Quote focuses on Internet business.
newsitem.headline: PC Quote focuses on Internet business.

text.p: PC Quote Inc said Wednesday it is continuing to negotiate the sale of its core business and remains focused on its Internet business.
PC Quote, which provides on-line stock and market quotes, said it is also in negotiations for working capital to relieve current cash constraints and to further fund the company's growth.
PC Quote reported on Wednesday a first quarter loss of $1.9 million or $0.26 a share versus a profit of $304,778 or $0.04. Revenues were $4.06 million, compared with $3.97 million last year.
The company pointed out that the loss narrowed from the fourth quarter, when PC Quote reported a loss of $0.45 a share versus a profit of $0.21.
PC Quote said more than 20 percent of first quarter revenues and more than 30 percent of April revenues were from its Internet business.

The company said it recently entered into a loan and security agreement with its principal shareholder, PICO Holdings Inc, providing for working capital loans of up to $1 million. PC Quote and PICO also restructured the terms of a $2.5 million subordinated convertible debenture, the company said.
"We believe these actions will allow us to focus on the rapidly evolving Internet-based services industry and remain a focused provider of electronic information," the company said.
In April, Track Data Corp said it entered into a non-binding letter of intent to acquire the non-Internet quotation business of PC Quote.
Shares of PC Quote were up 1/16 at 1-9/16.
